title: Unclean shutdown throws geth 4-5 days behind
body:
#### System information

Geth
Version: 1.10.19-stable
Architecture: amd64
Go Version: go1.18.4
Operating System: linux (CentOS 9)

#### Actual behaviour
First off, I am using a custom modified geth, however I tend to think the issue is more global. So anytime my geth gets killed for whatever reason (eg. by OOM killer etc.), it complains on head state missing (understandably) and starts 4 to 5 days back (given it's been running for at least this amount of time)

#### Expected behaviour
geth should better maintain state so that unclean shutdown does not throw it back so far (it takes considerable amount of time to re-sync and get it back to speed)

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
Have geth running for >4 days. Then SIGKILL it eg. `kill -9 <pid>` and try starting

Note `age=4d4h41m` in the log excerpt:
